messages.subject: Things to do with toddlers

messages.messageBody:
M. Cossey, you didn't name your post, so I've named my response.

There was a chat a while back specifically about things to do with
toddlers, and there are many links that came out of the discussion!

http://sandradodd.com/youngchildren

Sandra

messages.msgSnippet: Hello! My son is 2.5 yo and we have decided to unschool. I feel so strongly about it, and feel in so many ways it has changed my life. I m currently getting
messages.messageBody:
Hello!

My son is 2.5 yo and we have decided to unschool. I feel so strongly about
it, and feel in so many ways it has changed my life. I'm currently getting
ideas from some Montessori books about how to get started with reading and
writing (we made and decorated our movable alphabet today!) I know I am just
having to learn to relax and not have every moment filled up every day with
activities, and I have found this message board so helpful in finding my
way, but I was wondering if you all could give me some ideas about the kinds
of things you did/do with your toddlers. Games, etc. We do so much already,
but I'm most interested in breaking out of our cycle and trying something
new.

Thanks in advance!

M. Cossey


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
